data.title: Typical Thai menu - well prepared
data.text: Broad range of Thai dishes, served at increasing levels of spiciness. Well prepared. Good service.  Beer and wine also.

data.title: Rim Talay Thai
data.text: A decent place to get lunch . They had reasonable lunch specials that were very good but not the greatest in terms of rich flavor . Nonetheless I feel this is a safe bet if you want a good lunch that isn't too heavy .

data.title: Lovely lunch
data.text:
I was wanting a quick lunch.

I joined about half a dozen other diners who were mainly couples and chose an indoor table for me: no airconditioning.  Lovely set up.

The manager was hospitaBLE.  i had 'island fried rice' with tomatoes, cashews, pork and some greens: a large serve that I could not finish together with Pepsi that was refilled when I wanted more.

Including a $2 tip the bill was $18.96 which is quite expensive but sales taxes in the USA can be high.  

There are outdoor tables as well.  The restaurant is 300 metres from the busy Oceanside Transit Center used by Amtrak, Coaster and Sprinter trains plus buses.

data.title: Yummy
data.text: I love Thai food!  I can and will eat it any time. When visiting Oceanside, CA, after a 6 hour drive, I was looking to pick up some Thai food and found this restaurant.  Their Panang Curry was outstanding!! Wish I lived closer...

data.title: Very Mixed
data.text:
Well, my meal was excellent but my wife's was very poor.

I had the Devils Wings and the Chicken Green Curry, both were very good.  My wife ordered shrimp,soup but they brought the wrong order and then her main course, Red Snapper, was very poor and very poor.  Nothing like we have had in Thailand, simple fish, well cooked and succulent.  This was lightly battered in something and deep fried and consequently very dry.

data.title: Best Pad Thai ever!
data.text: My husband and I had an amazing lunch here! The lunch specials are decently priced with big portions. We had green curry and pad Thai and both were delicious! This will be my new go-to Thai restaurant.

data.title: Great food and service, internal chairs could be more comfortable
data.text: Went for a Thai meal as two couples. For two of us it was our first experience of Thai cuisine. We chose a mix of entrees including a red and a green curry. For each dish we were asked to grade our required spiciness from 1 to 10. Unfortunately we had nothing to benchmark this scale with and so we all chose 5. For the two of us who had eaten Thai before, perhaps we should have gone 7; for the newcomers who are regular eaters of Indian curries, but not Thai, would have been better with a 3. The service was generally excellent, but we were not very comfortable in the chairs. Price very reasonable for such a pleasant dining experience. we will return next time we are in town.

data.title: Great small mom pop Thai restaurant
data.text:
I live in the neighborhood and have frequented this restaurant to bring house guests, who love the food - especially the salads. 
Great value for the money.  Owners are very nice, service excellent.

data.title: Wonderful Meal
data.text: Delicious food prepared and served by friendly staff with the owners involved in front and in back. Each of our party of 6 had different types of dishes, all prepared well and presented beautifully. They can make vegetarian, vegan, gluten free, and in spiced on a scale of 1 to 10 for both the mild and fire breathing in your group.

data.title: Nice food
data.text:
Nice selection of Thai dishes, recommend their specialties. Also classics on the menu. Not too spicy, if you like real Thai spicy you need to go for level 9 or better 10.
Very friendly staff!

data.title: Excellent Food and they understand Gluten Free
data.text: The food was amazing and I felt confident in their understanding of gluten free. The service was great and the location was charming.

data.title: Love this food!
data.text:
Ever found a restaurant where your mouth waters before you look at the menu? Rim Talay is wonderful food, a great environment with exceptional customer service.  
Charmaine Hammond
Blogger for Canadian Traveller Magazine and
Fraserway RV 
Hammond International Inc.

data.title: Five is mild not medium
data.text:
We love Thai food and Rim Talay has an excellent selection using fresh ingredients. I think I would return because the food was good but the challenge was ordering the correct amount of heat on a scale from one to 10. We ordered at level 5 which was very mild rather than medium. Next time I would probably order at level 7 or 8.

My favorite soup, Tom Yum, was very disappointing. The flavor of the broth was excellent but there was hardly anything else in the soup, Small bits of chicken and few discernible vegetables.

The service was prompt and the wine good.

data.title: Best Thai around!
data.text: My boyfriend has Celiac, so our eating out options are very limited, but we love Rim Talay.  The food is fresh and delicious and the prices are reasonable.  The servers are super nice, too.  Can't recommend this place enough.

data.title: Great Thai Food!
data.text: Wonderful food and service!  I had their spicy garlic chicken which was excellent!  We ate outside, but there was some construction going on next to the restaurant that did distract from their pleasant outdoor dining.

data.title: Good food,good customer service
data.text: I find this resturant next to my hotel.My families love thai food.we order Patt thai and spice seafood.The food very testy and fresh.

data.title: Good Thai Food in Oceanside
data.text: Casual, easy going type of place. Nice menu. Pleasant, efficent service. Have been for both lunch and dinner and have always enjoyed the meal.

data.title: great local thai restaurant
data.text: informal casual quick service economical, excellent food enjoyed everything i ordered a good bet for the area

data.title: Rim Talay, Oceanside, California
data.text:
First time at this place. We were not there at the peak of lunch hour, so, the service was very fast and very courteous. 
I had the Basil and Garlic Stir Fry with chicken, the bell peppers, carrots, and onions were cooked to perfection. My companion was very pleased with the Sweet and Sour stir fry. For desert we really enjoyed the Sticky Rice and Mango, one of my favorites, and a fabulous Coconut Ice Cream.

data.title: Excellent choice!
data.text:
Having never eaten Thai food before, I didn't know what to expect. I ordered the Pad Thai and we shared an appetizer platter. All the food on the platter was excellent. I poured the leftover sauce on the Pad Thai as it was a bit bland for my taste. With the spicy sauce, it was delicious. Everyone seems to thoroughly enjoy their meals. 

Some outdoor seating....inside is quite tiny, maybe 8 to 10 tables. Nice atmosphere and friendly staff.
